column5: So in my search for an alternative to crap-bucket for photo hosting I went through some photos I had on flickr. These would be from a trip to Mexico in February of 2005.         These are likely film photos from a disposable waterproof camera that where put on a cd.
Awesome! What is that fish you have gaffed?  Thanks for sharing Rob!  I need to ocean fish at least once in this lifetime
The little one was a barracuda and the bigger one on the gaff was a wahoo I believe.
... and it looks like Flickr works fine for photo posting.
Wahoo, what a great tasting mild fish. We have a cheap ($2/lb) source for battered/frozen Wahoo and the stuff is delicious.
I see baby barracuda, wahoo (although I first thought it was a kingfish), and then a ballyhoo (they make fine bait)
Is Flickr cumbersome and slow Rob, or do you find it quick and easy to upload many images at once like PB?
I've only just starting using it again and haven't uploaded many photos. Once hunting season starts hopefully I'll have some batches to load and share.
